doc.headline: Powerful cyclone kills 41 in Bangladesh, forces evacuation of hundreds of thousands

text.p: A cyclone that slammed into Bangladesh's coast with 240 kph (140 mph) winds killed at least 41 people, leveled homes and forced the evacuation of 650,000 villagers before heading inland and losing power Friday, officials said.

Tropical Cyclone Sidr roared across the country's southwestern coast late Thursday with driving rain and high waves, leaving about 41 villagers dead from falling debris, local officials and the Meteorological Department said.

By early Friday, the cyclone had weakened into a tropical storm and was moving across the country to the northeast, with overcast skies and wind speed falling to 60 kilometers per hour (37 mph), the department said.
